Knuddlefish - Level 1

This legend shows you the possible class names you can use. To change the number of knuddlefish, just add or remove HTML (the comments show where rows and individuals begin and end). hide-children is a utility class, which you can ignore.

Knuddlefish Body

<div class="knuddle knuddle--[true, false, noinfo, both]">

Ears

<div class="ears ears--[up, down]">

Mouths

<div class="mouth mouth--[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]">

Number of Eyes

<div class="eyeballs eyeballs--[one, two, three, none]">

Pupil Direction

Pupil direction is numbered, and can be controlled independently. Direction 1 means centered, 2-7 are in a clockwise sequence.
<div class="pupils-[left, center, right, none] pupils--direction-[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7]">

Tentacles

Tentacle 1 is in front, tentacle 3 is in back (L or R denote the side). Active means the tentacle is pointing at its adjacent neighbor.
<div class="tentacles-[l1, l2, l3, r1, r2, r3] tentacles-l1--[active, inactive]">

Spots (statements about neighbors)

Spots mirror the tentacle selectors.
<div class="spots-[l1, l2, l3, r1, r2, r3] spots--[true, false, noinfo, both, none]">
